remarks:
Introduce an antecedent to both sides of a logical equivalence.  This and the next three rules are useful for building up wff's around a definition, in order to make use of the definition.  (Contributed by NM, 3-Jan-1993.)  (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 6-Feb-2013.) 

---

 Introduce an antecedent to both sides of a logical equivalence. (Contributed by NM, 5-Aug-1993.)  (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 6-Feb-2013.)
statement:
imbi2i.1 $e |- ( ph <-> ps ) $.
imbi2i $p |- ( ( ch -> ph ) <-> ( ch -> ps ) ) $.
